entry.title: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an internal table
entry.content:
Hello there.

Is there any method I can use to load files to internal tables in ABAP2XLSX ?

I mean, a method like FM ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE, that returns a table with fields: row, col and value.
But with an extra field:  worksheet_number, row, col and value.

I've read some post like this with specific solutions for a concrete internal table, but I would like to have a more generic method for any internal table.

https://adityaaufar.medium.com/most-common-use-case-of-abap2xlsx-excel-file-to-internal-table-92b3d1f6d710

If nothing similar exists, I will create a function for this, or perhaps, if you are interested, a new method in the ZCL_EXCEL_READER_2007 class.

Regards.

entry.title: Managing Misconduct in SAP Successfactors : An MDF-Driven Approach
entry.content:
Introduction :
In this blog we will explore handling misconduct cases by creating a dedicated section in SAP Successfactors Employee Central, this section will help business take the right action based on based on structured inputs.

Context : 

A while ago a customer requested a section for Misconducts that will be visible for Managers and there is going to be a workflow for HR to approve of the misconduct to be applied on their direct reports.

Solution Overview :

An MDF to be Placed on People Profile that will generate Sanctions to be applied on employee based on Inputs done by Managers.

We will need 4 MDFs 

[1 for Misconduct Types , 2 will be a parent and child MDF essentially to work as a table that we will lookup upon, 1 Will be visible on the Employee Profile] 

Flow of the Process :

In my case it was the manager who initiates the sanctions, So once the manager selects the misconduct & Occurrence it will propagate sanctions to be applied on the employee and once save HR will choose to approve or decline.


Creating the MDFs :

1- Misconduct Types : This will be all Misconducts types in the business list plain and simple , we will create all of these misconducts via Import and export 
Example :
Type of a Misconduct

 
2- Now we will head to Parent & Child MDFs , Parent will be same as Misconduct type it will just work as a container of the upcoming mdf as it just feels better to keep track without modifying in the source so, Now in the Child Object 
we will create fields like [ Misconduct Types we will refer to the previous MDF we created in this one , 1st Time , 2nd , 3rd , 4th these fields depending on the business as it will contain the deduction amount/ or some might be just a warning] 

Example : 
Misconduct Details working as a Container for all types of Possible Misconduct and their Sanctions

 

 

We will Import Misconduct Details which is Misconduct Type & Sanctions to be applied for each occurrence.

3- MDF to be Visible in the People Profile :
This MDF will be placed in a section on People Profile ,but before that we need to set the business rule that will help the Manager choose the correct sanctions to be applied based on the Internal Policy we got.

I did make it on change and to be placed on a field in this MDF as per the customer desire you can make it on save.
Business Rule :

 

This will cover the 1st time ,so you will need to do the rest to cover all the sanctions.

Now this is how it's going to look like once manager chooses the inputs :

 
At the end once it's saved a workflow will be sent to HR to either approve / decline.

Conclusion : 

This setup is just the starting point for managing misconduct in a clear and consistent way in SuccessFactors. With a few MDFs, rules, and a workflow, managers can take action and HR can stay in control.

This is first step I'd say ? The next blog would be automating it so it posts directly the deduction in the Non Recurring Pay Component Section and make sure it's replicated to Payroll.

Thank you all for your time.

entry.title: Re: New Use Cases for SAP Connectivity in SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery
entry.content:
If you use the connectivity proxy not to access an on-premises registry, but for example to connect to an on-premises backend in your tests, fetching dependencies from the public npm registry might fail with "405 method not allowed".

In this case it should help to configure 'noproxy' in your .cicd_npmrc:

proxy=${CONN_PROXY}
noproxy=registry.npmjs.org

entry.title: Release 2511: Transitioning to .cloud.sap: What You Need to Know
entry.content:
As technology continues to evolve, so do the platforms and domains we rely on. One recent development is the transition from ondemand.com to cloud.sap. This shift is part of a broader effort to streamline services.

Here’s a brief overview of what this means for you:

  • It is highly recommended that you update the URLs in your documentation to use the cloud.sap domain.

  • Ensure that your configurations and bookmarks are updated to reflect the new domain.

  • No immediate removal of the old domain: There are currently no plans to remove the ondemand.com domain. Existing URLs will continue to function for the time being.

  • New customers will use the new domain: All new customers will be directed to use cloud.sap from the outset. This ensures a smoother transition and reduces redundancy in the future.

Thank you for your cooperation and understanding as we continue to enhance our services and platforms.

entry.title: Re: Data Migration Cockpit reporting data already migrated
entry.content:
Dear @VolkerLe, 

Data migration cockpit is only used for creation.
We can not edit the data or already created data using DMC.

If extending of the material or any master data is required there will be a different template for extending 
Ex: Material Extension by Org level.

Hope this helps!!!


Best Regards,
Surya.

entry.title: SAC OAuth Client cannot read all files in filerespository
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I'm using the filerepository API (/api/v1/filerepository/Resources) to retrieve information about our content in SAC. During development I found out, that the OAuth Client cannot read files where "All users" don't have view access. I would have assumed that an OAuth Client for API usage would have access to all files?

When using the /api/v1/Resources API this OAuth client can even read stories from private folders, so the user has definitely enhanced privileges. However, the Resources API only reads stories, but we also want to retrieve resource from resourceType=ANALYSIS_WORKBOOK.

How can we give the OAuth Client access to all files (or add it to our team for administrators, so it can find all files)?

Best regards,
Harald

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an internal table
entry.content:
I'm not used to using ABAP2XLSX, I thought it would be more complicated.
I've just created a simple report to do that, I think it would be interesting to have some generic method to do something similar.

REPORT zfile_to_table.

PARAMETERS:
  pa_file TYPE string   LOWER CASE OBLIGATORY,
  pa_n_ws TYPE sy-tabix OBLIGATORY DEFAULT 10,
  pa_ncol TYPE sy-tabix OBLIGATORY DEFAULT 20,
  pa_nrow TYPE sy-tabix OBLIGATORY DEFAULT 5000.

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST                                *
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR pa_file.
  PERFORM file_browser CHANGING pa_file.

START-OF-SELECTION.
  PERFORM load_file.

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      Form  FILE_BROWSER
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       text
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
*      <--P_PA_FILE  text
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM file_browser  CHANGING p_lv_file.

  DATA:
    lv_titulo    TYPE string,
    lv_rc        TYPE i,
    lv_filename  TYPE rlgrap-filename,
    ls_filetable TYPE file_table,
    lt_filetable TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF file_table.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = lv_titulo
      default_extension = '*.*'
*     file_filter       = '(*.xls)|*.slx|'
      initial_directory = 'U:\'
    CHANGING
      file_table        = lt_filetable
      rc                = lv_rc.

  READ TABLE lt_filetable INDEX 1 INTO ls_filetable.
  IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
    p_lv_file = ls_filetable-filename.
  ENDIF.

ENDFORM.                    " FILE_BROWSER

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&      Form  load_file
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*       text
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  -->  p1        text
*  <--  p2        text
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM load_file .

  TYPES:
    BEGIN OF tys_data,
      worksheet TYPE i,
      row       TYPE i,
      col       TYPE i,
      value     TYPE zexcel_cell_value,
    END OF tys_data,
    tyt_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF tys_data.

  DATA:
    lv_current_ws  TYPE sy-tabix,
    lv_current_row TYPE sy-tabix,
    lv_current_col TYPE sy-tabix,
    ls_data        TYPE tys_data,
    lt_data        TYPE tyt_data.

*TYPE REF TO ZCL_EXCEL_WORKSHEET

  DATA(lo_reader) = CAST zif_excel_reader( NEW zcl_excel_reader_2007( ) ). "Initialize Excel Reader
  DATA(lo_excel) = lo_reader->load_file( pa_file ).                         "Read data from Parameter

  DO pa_n_ws TIMES.

    ADD 1 TO lv_current_ws.

    DATA(lo_worksheet) = lo_excel->get_worksheet_by_index( lv_current_ws ).
    IF lo_worksheet IS NOT BOUND.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.

    CLEAR: lv_current_row.
    DO pa_nrow TIMES.

      ADD 1 TO lv_current_row.

      CLEAR: lv_current_col.
      DO pa_ncol TIMES.

        ADD 1 TO lv_current_col.

        CLEAR: ls_data-value.

        lo_worksheet->get_cell( EXPORTING
                                   ip_column = lv_current_col
                                   ip_row    = lv_current_row
                                 IMPORTING
                                   ep_value  = ls_data-value
                               ).

        IF ls_data-value IS NOT INITIAL.
          ls_data-worksheet = lv_current_ws.
          ls_data-row       = lv_current_row.
          ls_data-col       = lv_current_col.
          APPEND ls_data TO lt_data.
        ENDIF.

      ENDDO.

    ENDDO.

  ENDDO.

ENDFORM.

entry.title: SAP ASE DBACOCKPIT: No recent DB Backups displayed (DB/Transaction Dumps)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Recently I have noticed in one system that no recent/current Database/Transaction backups (dumps) are dispayed in the DBACockpit (Database SID --> Backups and Revovery --> Database Overview/History). Outdated database/Transaction dumps dating back to May 2025 can be seen in the overview (see screenshot attached). No error messages are displayed.

Regular database/transaction backups are created via our backup tool 'Commvault'. Backups can be seen in Commvault's backup history. Backups (dumps) can also be seen from the system dump history file at OS-Level (/sybase/SID/ASE-16_0/dumphist.SID). Also querying the 'sp_dump_history' via isql shows all backups taken.

What I did notice the outdated backups seen (dating from May 2025) in the DBACockpit seem to coincide with an DB-Update performed around that time.

Does anybody come up with an idea?.

Thanks a lot.

Thorsten

entry.title: Re: Lessons Learned: Fetching Learning History from SuccessFactors LMS Using OData APIs
entry.content:
Hi @MateuszPiotrowski,

Thanks a lot for the feedback! Really glad you found the tutorial useful.

And that’s a great security tip — I completely agree. Using the Authorization header with Bearer <token> is definitely the safer approach, since CPI automatically anonymizes it in trace logs. This way, sensitive tokens aren’t exposed in plain text while debugging or monitoring.

Appreciate you highlighting this point — it’s an important best practice for anyone implementing these integrations.

entry.title: Inspection setup audit log Issue
entry.content:
Hi,

When we perform MM02, the inspection setup log is generated correctly. However, when we try to delete an inspection setup line item using a BAPI, the change log is not generated in Display Changes.

Could you please let us know if there is any standard BAPI available that can generate change logs when deleting an existing inspection setup line item

Thanks


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Inspection setup audit log Issue
entry.content:
Hi,

thank you for the details provided.

Please check BAPI BAPI_MATINSPCTRL_SAVEREPLICA.

It has a table INSPECTIONCTRL, where field FUNCTION decides about the activity to happen with the entries entered.

Possible values of the field (as per its domain MSGFN):

  • 003 - Delete: Message contains objects to be deleted
  • 004 - Change: Message contains changes
  • 005 - Replace: This message replaces previous messages
  • 009 - Original: First message for process
  • 023 - Wait/Adjust: Do not import data
  • 018 - Resend

Therefore, if you plan to create an inspection type in the material master, use function code 009, while for deletion 003.

A screenshot about the tested feature will be pasted below, into an additional comment.

Have a nice day,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Work Zone Security
entry.content:
A user attempts to access an application.

Cloud Identity Service authenticates the user through IAS using their credentials.

Once authenticated, the system checks with IPS to determine if the user has the necessary permissions to access the application. If granted, access is provided. If not, access is denied. IPS is used to provisioning users from one system to another, I have recently provisioned my sap on prem system user to IAS.

entry.title: Modifying posting information in the Purchase Order Accruals Process – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
1. Purchase Order Accruals Process Overview

The Purchase Order Accruals tool allows you to automatically calculate and add accruals to the General Ledger.
It works by taking data from the Materials Management area and then changing purchase order items into accrual items using the Accrual Engine. This process calculates how much should be accrued for each purchase order item, and you can even test these calculations before applying them. Each period, you can trigger an accrual run that will post all accruals related to various business activities.

This application supports Parallel Accounting, meaning you can calculate and post accruals across different ledger groups at the same time.
From a technical standpoint, the tool is based on the Accrual Engine, where purchase order items become accrual items. While Purchase Order Accruals handles these items, the Accrual Engine deals with the calculation and posting of accruals.

After a purchase order is made, it gets automatically transferred to the Accrual Engine based on how your settings are configured to manage these postings.
In the Accrual Engine, each purchase order is assigned an accrual object.

 

2. The case for posting data change

In the dynamic world of financial accounting, businesses often encounter scenarios where standard functionalities may not align perfectly with specific regulatory or operational requirements.
Purchase Order Accruals play a critical role in maintaining accurate financial records, especially across various ledgers. However, the diverse nature of global accounting practices, such as differing Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), can necessitate adjustments in how accruals are posted. Businesses might find that certain accrual postings must be customized to comply with local regulations or internal policies. This requires a more flexible approach to modify specific posting data, ensuring precision and adherence to relevant accounting standards.

In the next chapters, we will explore some possibilities in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition when the change of posting data in Purchase Order Accrual postings is required. By understanding these factors, companies can better navigate the potential pitfalls and implement effective solutions that cater to their unique accounting needs.

 

3.  Understanding Accrual Engine Dependencies - Configuration

To begin utilizing the purchase order accrual features, you first need to activate the Purchase Order Accruals application, which involves enabling the appropriate scope item. Depending on your specific needs, you may also need to adjust configuration settings to ensure the functions align with your requirements, like add a review procedure.

There are several configuration options available that allow for personalization of the accrual functionalities. For instance, you can modify settings that determine which purchase order items will have accruals posted, as well as the manner of their posting.

The accrual engine configuration in SAP Public Cloud is company code dependent and not Ledger dependent, meaning you can define different conditions for different company codes. The Accrual Methods available are pre-delivered.

 

4. Exploring the use of BAdi´s to tailor the procedure to different requirements

You add Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) to the functions to fit the procedure to your regulatory or operational requirements.

There are some BAdis available for Accrual processes, namely:

  • BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD – Modify Journal Entry Line Items
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHNG_DATE – Change completion date
  • BADI_ACE_ACCHIVING_CHECK – Change result of check
  • BADI_ACE_DOC_FIELDS_MAPPING – ACE document fields mapping
  • FACRA_ADJMT_TOLERANCE_CHECK – Adjustment tolerance check

Particularly relevant for posting modifications is BADI_ACE_DOCUMENT_SCHEMA_CLD, which enables to set below values for journal entry lines:

  •      cost_center (cost center)
  •      profit_center (profit center)
  •      glaccount (G/L account)
  •      item_text (item text of the journal entry item)

 

You can implement custom BAdI logic tailored to your business needs in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition through the Custom Logic App. Find more here.

 

5. Exploring API alternatives to tailor the procedure to different requirements

SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides several APIs for journal entry management that might help in adjusting accrual amounts before posting.

Some key notes on using API for Journal Entry Adjustments:

  • API Journal Entry - Post (Synchronous/Asynchronous): These APIs allow for the posting of journal entries from external systems to your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.
    Find more here.

 

  • API Journal Entry by Ledger - Post (Asynchronous): This API enables uploading multiple journal entry documents with ledger group information.
    Find more here.

 

This post contains information updated for 2508 version.
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: User Provisioning Issue in SAP Build Work Zone, Stand...
entry.content:
Hello Rohit,

Thank you for the details. 

If the job ran successfully without errors, then the users should be in IAS. There is no other place to look at them other than user management. Can you paste a screenshot of the provisioning log after a successful job run. I would also clear browser cache and cookies and restart the browser. 

Can you check if there are any properties that are filtering out the rest of the users? Most likely something is not matching and thus a subset of users only are getting synched. 

Julius

entry.title: How to avoid partials supplies
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

We have created a lot of articles in SAP related to cables, every different code linked to the type (regarding to the number and section of  wires, shielded or not, ...). We use as a measure units the "PC" (pieces) unit that is an equivalent of meters. The problem appear when we create a need in the system of a X meters (IT'S NECESSARY THE ALL QTY JUST IN A ONE PIECE) and we have a partial quantity at warehouse... For instance: we need 20m and there are 5m at warehouse. In this case the warehouse supply 5m and we buy 15m by the other hand. So at the end we'll have the cable into 2 pieces.

Do you know if it is possible to avoid this situation? How?

Thanks in advance!

Xavi.

entry.title: Issue in finding documents assigned to a Work Item

Regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Issue in finding documents assigned to a Work Item
entry.content:
Hello,

you may use the Soldoc report 'Related Documents' - Open - and filter by Type = KWOBJ and execute. Note that prerequisite for this report is in Solman_Setup - Process Management - Configure Solution Documentation - Define Visibility of Related Documents in Reports.
Once you execute this, you can filter by Type, Related Document and ID. 

Best regards
SAP Product Support

entry.title: Re: How to change Define Procedures (ID: 106765)
entry.content:
Create condition types or modify condition types is not allowed with Configuration Item Define procedure (106765) in Public Cloud, with the exception of Argentina. This is the standard system behaviour. 

 A feature request can be raised in the SAP Customer Influence page if needed.

However, there is still a issue with grouping in SAP CALM:

CALM Alert Behavior
I have also observed the following behavior when multiple messages fail in CPI with the same artifact/error:
  • New message IDs are appended to the same open alert.
  • The corresponding ServiceNow incident shows only an “Updated at xx:xx:xx am/pm” timestamp, without the new message IDs or error details.
  • Once the open alert is confirmed/closed, the next failure generates a new alert and incident, which then includes the message IDs that were previously part of the earlier alert.

Can suppression rules be fine-tuned so that repeat errors within a defined window either: Create separate incidents with full details, depending on severity or business needs?

Do we need to seek clarification from SAP and align our configurations accordingly.

Thanks,

Indu Khurana.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1: Final What's New & Product Assistance available
entry.content:
With immediate effect, the final What's New information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 is now available.

To access the final What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer. In addition, the final Product Assistance (aka Application Help) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 is available. Please use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Help Portal page to access it.

For you as a customer, we recommend to also use the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool. The Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 will be available in RASD within the next few days. A valid Customer S-user ID is required for login. We recommend to use RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you as a customer.

You can use the commenting feature for What’s New. With this feature, authors can evaluate your feedback and incorporate it into the documentation, if needed. We hope that by opening this channel of communication, we can learn how to further improve our What’s New content for you. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the Help Portal. The feature will only be available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

entry.title: Effortless Integration: Archiving Service Cloud V2 Emails to OpenText
entry.content:
How It Works: A Seamless Process

This integration is triggered whenever a case is created or updated in SAP Service Cloud V2. The process is designed for a seamless, hands-off user experience:

  • A user triggers the process from a custom field within SAP Service Cloud V2
  • The iFlow retrieves the most recent email and any attachments associated with the specific service case.
  • The email body is converted into a universally readable PDF format to ensure compliance and audit readiness.
  • The system downloads all attachments linked to the email.
  • Finally, the formatted email and attachments are uploaded to OpenText and linked to the corresponding case for streamlined case management and compliance.
  • OpenText content management is embedded within SAP Service Cloud and users have access to OpenText’s embedded AI for analyzing documents stored within the workspace.

 

 

  • Key Features You'll Love

    • Dynamic Email Retrieval: The iFlow is configured to always fetch the most recent email, ensuring you have the latest information at your fingertips.
    • Universal Format: By converting the email body to a PDF, the solution guarantees that your records are stored in a universally readable and compliant format.
    • Comprehensive Attachment Handling: The process supports multiple attachments, archiving them alongside the email for a complete record.
    • Robust Error Handling: The system includes error-handling branches to automatically retry processes or log failures, ensuring reliability and data integrity.

      Technical Reliability

      This iFlow is deployed in SAP Cloud Integration and is triggered by an HTTP API call from SAP Service Cloud V2. It uses OAuth2-based authentication for secure communication with both SAP Service Cloud V2 and OpenText APIs. A custom Python API deployed on Cloud Foundry helps prepare the content for archiving.

  • S4RD2 SAP S/4HANA Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC)
    This is a delta course. It contains the deltas related to variant configuration from SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA on the corresponding release. The main focus is on Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC).

We do not provide a certification for this topic.

Kind reards
Margit

entry.title: IBS/CBS - Tax Reform - Collection & disbursement
entry.content:
Taxation Processes:

The new taxes will replace some existing taxes over time. Taxes like IR (Income Tax), INSS (Social Security Contribution), and CSLL (Social Contribution on Net Profit) will remain unchanged.

IBS (Tax on Goods and Services):

  • Will cover the ISS for the Insurance industry, which is currently based on service type.
  • Calculated considering:
    • IBS for Jurisdiction
    • IBS for State
  • IBS Jurisdiction can follow the same procedure as ISS based on Jurisdiction code on BP side.
  • IBS State may require using the BP address to identify the state.
  • The proposal is to have a unique tax rate, but flexibility to have different taxes for different states and jurisdictions should be considered during customization.

CBS (Contribution on Goods and Services):

  • Will cover the PIS/COFINS taxation.
  • The customization for this new Federal tax could follow the same IBS proposal.
  • Tax reduction can be expected in some cases.

Attention Points and Definitions:

  • The new taxes should be withheld and not mixed with the old ones.
  • No dependency should be created between new and old taxes, including tax base, tax reduction, etc.

IBS State and Jurisdiction Details:

  • For IBS Jurisdiction, the same method can be used in customizing by creating a Tax supplement and relating it to a GL account.
  • This tax is triggered at the time of payment.
  • The same customization method can be used to choose the Portion Subject of Tax and the Tax percentage.
  • No threshold limit has been defined for this tax.
  • Calculation is only possible if the currency is BRL.
  • The taxation will have a fixed tax rate per jurisdiction and state, but different tax rates and portion reductions may exist in the same jurisdiction or state, potentially differentiated by service type.
  • For customizing IBS state and jurisdiction, the same procedure used in ISS can be used to choose the jurisdiction and state.
  • Different fields are needed to configure the tax rate, which will be collected based on the service local executed.
  • These new taxes have no dependencies on each other, so there is no need to set Tax Sequence.
  • A TAX FM could be interesting to maintain for the flexibility point of view, in case the external system already calculates these taxes and needs to feed our system with this information.

CBS Federal Tax Details:

  • CBS is a Federal tax, and the same procedure as adopted for Tax Code and Tax Supplement can be followed.
  • This taxation will replace PIS/COFINS, so the same approach can be used or another that is more convenient.
  • Flexibility could be interesting to keep, as well as Portion reduction, differentiate by type of segment (currently per service type).
  • Some rules based on this tax may change in the future.

Practical Implications for Now (2025)

  • No CBS or IBS collection yet; both are scheduled to begin in 2026.

  • Systems should be configured to support 0.9% CBS and 0.1% IBS for the transition, while remaining adaptable for rate increases.

  • Legacy taxes (PIS, COFINS, ICMS, ISS) still apply until they're phased out progressively.

The solution will be released in FSCD until the end of September 2025.

entry.title: Using Technical User in SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs (Client Credentials)
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere exposes business-ready data through a set of Consumption APIs that make it easy for BI tools and applications to query governed data without copying it. The Consumption APIs endpoints generated from Analytical Datasets and Analytic Models offer a metadata-rich, RESTful interface that applications can call for filtered, paged results, which have been available since early 2021. 

To allow all this richness of data and the benefits of federation capabilities, the SAP Dataspshere Consumption APIs always relied on business users for authentication and authorizations, which is based OAuth 2.0 with Authorization Code grant type. Such scenario ensured the same behaviour the user sees in the SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics applications would be the one be the same when integrating via APIs, including Data Access Controls and Model Privileges.

However such authorization method is not the most adequate to be used when integration in backend application, in a service-to-service manner. As in most cases the backend application does not have an current user session or ability to access a browser context as required by Authorization Code grant type 3-lagged approach.

With that we heard our users requests and pleased to release the "Technical User" support for the SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs which is based on OAuth 2.0 with Client Credentials grant type (2-legged). This allows the access token generation to happen without any manual user interaction.

This blog post cover details on how to create the "Technical User" OAuth Client in SAP Datasphere, how to setup the client credentiral authorization in Postman and the support for it on Power BI Custom Connector.

Technical User OAuth Client

The Technical User OAuth client work just like the other OAuth clients existing in SAP Datasphere. To define the authorizations for the technical user at least one scoped role needs to be assigned to it, this will determine which spaces the technical user will have access and the privileges it will have in them.  Also, to identify the requests made and to apply data access restrictions a "Username" must be provided, this technical user name needs to be unique across the entire SAP Datasphere tenant.

For creating a Technical User OAuth client, go to System > Administration > App Integration and provide the following information

  • Purpose: Technical User
  • User ID:  <unique username>
  • Roles: <Select at least one scoped role>

After creating it generates a "Client ID" and a "Client Secret", just like the other OAuth client types.

 

Integrating with Consumption APIs in Postman

Integrating with SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs using a Technical User OAuth client is straightforward because it uses the Client Credentials grant type. Using the client_id and client_secret created in the previous section, along with the SAP Datasphere token URL available on the App Integration page, you can use any HTTP client (e.g., Postman) to generate an access token and call the Consumption APIs.

Access Token Generation

Postman Automated OAuth Setup

Postman’s automated authorization handles all the necessary OAuth 2.0 calls to retrieve and apply the token. To set this up, create a new request and open the Authorization tab. For Type, select OAuth 2.0 and fill in the following information:

  • Header Prefix: Bearer
  • Grant type: Client Credentials
  • Access Token URL: <SAP Datasphere Token URL available the App Integration page>
  • Client ID: <client_id - created on previous step>
  • Client Secret: <client_secret - created on previous step>

After you complete the fields, click Get New Access Token. Postman will generate an access token for SAP Datasphere.

Postman Manual OAuth Setup

Postman’s approach in the previous section automates the OAuth protocol, which is helpful for testing and speeding up debugging, but less practical for real integrations. This section explains how to craft the OAuth token request required by the Client Credentials flow for use with a SAP Datasphere Technical User.

Create a request in Postman and configure:

  • Method: POST
  • Request URL: <token_url> (the SAP Datasphere token URL available on the App Integration page)

Headers:

  • Authorization: Basic <base64 encoded client_id:client_secret>
  • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Body (x-www-form-urlencoded):

  • grant_type: client_credentials

Send the request to retrieve the access token, which you will use later.

 

Changes on SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs

The SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs let you retrieve data via OData version 4. Starting with release 2025.19, the standard API path has been updated to align with proper service naming following the 2023 transition from SAP Data Warehouse Cloud to SAP Datasphere and its continued role within the SAP Business Data Cloud strategy.

  • New path: /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/*

The catalog service for consumption artifacts, which lists and queries all accessible spaces and entities, has moved to /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/catalog/* to better reflect its purpose. All other semantics for accessing spaces and assets remain unchanged.

The relational and analytical consumption endpoints retain exactly the same behavior, with only the path prefix changed, for example:

  • /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/(relational | analytical)/*

The previous path, /api/v1/dwc/(catalog|consumption), is deprecated. It will continue to be supported for 18 months, until March 2027.

Consuming with Technical User

You can use the Technical User with both the old and new API paths. Once you switch to Technical User authorization, it is recommended to move to the new standard endpoints.

When you make requests to the Consumption APIs with Technical User authorization, the privileges and space memberships applied to the request are determined by the scoped roles assigned to the OAuth client used to generate the access token.

For example, consider spaces A, B, and C. If the OAuth client has roles that grant consumption permissions for spaces A and C, then:

  • In catalog queries, only assets from spaces A and C are returned.
  • For data consumption, only models belonging to or shared with spaces A and C are accessible.

An example request is shown in the image below, which requests data from a view in relational format, use the generated access token from previous step as Bearer Authorization.

Important notice: Consuming data from assets protected by Data Access Controls is not supported at this time. The API will return an empty result.

 

Integration with Power BI via Custom Connector

Back in 2022, olaf_fischer and I worked on easing the integration between Power BI and the SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs by releasing an open source sample Power BI Custom Connector that supports SSO, making it easy to authenticate and consume the OData APIs in Power BI.

Although the custom connector has its limitations and active development has ceased, the introduction of a new authorization type is a significant improvement. Since the connector is used by many, it deserved an update to align with the latest features. I am happy to share that version 1.90 of the open source custom connector now supports authorization via OAuth 2.0 with client credentials.

More details on the custom connector can be found at original blog post or on the GitHub Repository

How to Use It in Power BI

  1. In the connector sign-in dialog, choose Authentication Method → “OAuth Client Credentials.”
  2. Enter the Client ID and Client Secret generated when you registered the app.
  3. Leave the existing Access Token URL in the system settings (connections.json file); no additional user details are required.

Backward-Compatibility Notes

  • Existing connections that use the Authorization Code flow continue to work unchanged.
  • You can reuse the same system configuration (Access Token URL) if you switch to the new Client Credentials flow later.
 

Summary

SAP Datasphere now supports Technical User access to the Consumption APIs with OAuth 2.0 client credentials, enabling service-to-service integrations without user interaction and thereby easing integration across multiple services and enabling many new use cases.

I’d be happy to hear your thoughts and comments on this topic. Let me know in the comments

entry.title: Re: Excited to Join the SAP Community
entry.content: Thank you Marcelo!!🤗

entry.title: How to set up Withholding Tax in Treasury Using Extended Withholding Tax
entry.content:
This blog describes setup of the withholding tax using integration from SAP Treasury and Risk Management (treasury) to the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting. Besides the calculation and accounting this integration also ensures that corresponding withholding tax information is added to the resulting accounting documents. Such documents are included in standard legal reports in a given country. There are also other possibilities to calculate and account withholding taxes, e.g. using derived flows, however the resulting documents usually lack all the necessary withholding tax information.

Pre-delivered configuration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables posting to supplier. However, this example scenario covers withholding tax on incoming interests in money market instruments posted to customer to describe all configuration steps. 

We focus on the configuration and master data related to withholding tax, we expect that you have already completed general setup for treasury and for the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting.

 

1          Customizing Prerequisites

The withholding tax code and tax type are defined in Financial Accounting.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Payment Time, the system generates the withholding tax only at the time of payment in the transaction F110 (Automatic Payment). In this case, treasury generates only an empty flow and a corresponding item for table WITH_ITEM with withholding tax base amount.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Invoice Time, the system generates the withholding tax line item in the accounting document of the interest. Treasury then generates a flow with withholding tax amount.

 

2          Customizing in Treasury

2.1       Define Update Type for Withholding Tax

In our example we use update type TAXWH01.

2.2       Define Account Determination for Interest

The extended withholding tax requires posting to supplier/customer, therefore it is necessary to set up account determination for interest in treasury accordingly.

2.2.1     Posting Specification

It contains document type for posting on customer and GL account. The posting key for debit entry is for customer, and the account symbol has posting category for subledger posting in payment currency.

2.2.2     Assign Update Type to Posting Specification

It is important to mark the indication Payment Transaction in the assignment of the update type to posting specification.

2.3       Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax

In this activity we assign the withholding tax update type to the interest update type.

Note. Only maintain key fields that are relevant for the actual interest flow. If you maintain securities account for interest from money market instrument, the configuration won’t be selected in the processing, because money market instrument doesn’t carry securities account.

If you have a scenario with interest for securities do not maintain transaction type, because interests in securities account management (transaction TPM40) don’t carry transaction type.

The assignment also contains the withholding tax type and withholding tax code.

 

3          Business Partner Master Data

The withholding tax data are maintained in the corresponding tab Customer: Withholding Tax        

Note that the withholding tax and withholding tax code must be same as in the activity Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax. Also, the indicator withholding tax agent must be set.

 

4         Processing of the financial transaction

4.1       Create Financial Transaction

Enter the money market transaction as usual. On payment details page, it is crucial that the interest is posted to customer and without payment request:

 

The generated planned withholding tax isn’t visible directly under the Cash Flow tab. You can check it in the transaction TPM13 Treasury Position Flows – Classic

Note that this is only planned withholding tax. In some cases, the withholding tax can depend on some limits related to the business partner, and so the resulting withholding tax at the time of posting can differ. The cash flow in TPM13 serves as a good indication whether everything is set up correctly and the withholding tax is generated.

4.2       Post financial transaction

The withholding tax is posted together with the interest in the transaction TBB1 (Fix, Pay, and Post Flows). There is a limitation in posting log, which puts withholding tax in two-line items, whereas resulting accounting document has only one line item for withholding tax.

For more information about the basic settings for withholding tax, see Withholding Tax in Treasury.

entry.title: Re: What are the free certification available for Consult...
entry.content:
This link that you have shared doesnt seem to be for partners. SAP employee clearly quoted the partner learning hub pricing to be less than 500$ USD, then why is this pointing to 1500?

Also,  the question is not answered- i thought a human would be more helpful than a chatbot, to guide us through the correct link.

The reason for asking this question is simple:  SAP sent a notification that says, free certification for partners, mainly in presales-sales etc., and upon checking further, the link is broken, and there is no clarity on the prerequisites etc., all it says is "get free sap cert in a day".

entry.title: Department Level RBP Control
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have association between Departments (Parent and Child). Each department has fields called Parent Department (data type: Department) and Head of Department (data type: User).


The Head of Department must have the capability to access the Department for which he/she serves as Head, as well as the ability to drill down to the lowest level of the department.

Please suggest on how it can be achieved via RBP.

Best Regards

entry.title: Re: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take in...
entry.content:
Hi,
For an SAP RAP service you need to use a table to project your CDS entities into (those will be your input and output data), if you don't want to, and if you are in a on-premise or Private Cloud S/4HANA System, you can use the SAP Gateway Builder (SEGW) to create entity types/sets directly and use function import for your need create the service function.
You can check an example here for Function import implementation https://signatov.com/using-function-import-in-an-odata-service/
